newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-News appoints Foxtel head to JSkyB.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-News appoints Foxtel head to JSkyB.

text.p: News Corp Ltd said on Thursday that Foxtel pay-TV head Mark Booth has been appointed chief operating officer of Japan Sky Broadcasting Ltd (JSkyB).
Booth, whose appointment takes effect immediately, has been chief executive officer of News Corp's Foxtel Australian pay-TV joint venture since November 1994.
News Corp chairman Rupert Murdoch said in a statement that Booth was an extremely talented and experienced pay-TV executive.

News said Foxtel director Tom Mockridge would take over as chief executive officer from Booth, who would remain on the board. Foxtel is a joint venture between News and Australian telecoms carrier Telstra Corporation.

JSkyB was established in December last year as an equal joint venture between News and Softbank Corp, with paid-in-capital of 20 billion yen. The venture, expected to begin operations in April 1998, is designed to provide multichannel satellite television to Japan, News Corp said.
